frame.name: Required_event
frame.definition:
<def-root>Unless a particular <fen>Required_situation</fen> obtains, <fen>Negative_consequences</fen> will follow. Alternatively, the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required to achieve a <fen>Purpose</fen> (which avoids <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>). A set of <fen>Circumstances</fen> may be specified under which the requirement holds.
<ex><fex name="req">You</fex> <t>must</t> <fex name="req">turn in your test by 5 p.m.</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="req">You</fex> <t>better</t> <fex name="req">have that fixed by tomorrow</fex> <fex name="neg">or else we'll fire you</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="req">The book</fex> <t>needs</t> <fex name="req">to be shorter</fex> <fex name="pur">to sell to such a young audience.</fex></ex>
Most, but not all, LUs of this frame are usable in a context that implies a duty or responsibility, concepts related to the Being_obligated frame. However, our analysis is that such interpretations are due to contextual pragmatic strengthening--in other words, a duty is a frequently salient type of purpose that has negative consequences if not achieved.</def-root>

FE.name: Negative_consequences
FE.definition: <def-root>An event or state of affairs that results if the required <fen>Required_situation</fen> does not occur and which impacts some deprofiled entity in a way that the speaker finds undesirable.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Circumstances</fen> encodes a setting, often temporal or spatial, within which the requirement holds.
</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The event or state of affairs that is achieved by bringing about the <fen>Required_situation</fen> and which entails the non-occurrance of <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period during which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary to prevent negative consequences.
<ex>He was told that <fex name="tim">when he got back</fex> , his column <t>needed</t> a serious rethink .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location within which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is required.
<ex><fex name="pla">In California</fex> , seatbelts <t>must</t> be fastened at all times .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The reason why the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary.
<ex> I do realize his pitch <t>needed</t> to be wide-ranging <fex name="exp">because of the differences between folks in the room</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is necessary. The <fen>Degree</fen> may either imply a modification of the direness of the <fen>Negative_consequences</fen>, the probability of the <fen>Negative_consequences</fen> (if the <fen>Required_situation</fen> is not made to hold), or both.
<ex>He <fex name="deg">absolutely</fex> <t>must</t> be replaced .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: must.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be strongly required in order to avoid negative consequences, social or otherwise

lexUnit.name: need.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be required in order to avoid negative consequences, usually physical

lexUnit.name: had better.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: would find it wiser to.

lexUnit.name: better.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: would find it wiser to.

lexUnit.name: got to.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be bound to a course of action by the possiblity of a negative outcome emerging from inaction

lexUnit.name: hafta.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: considering oneself obligated to do something for fear of negative consequences with inaction (fast speech for 'have to')

lexUnit.name: be supposed (to).v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be required or expected to do something.

lexUnit.name: shall.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: indicates an obligated or determined event
